title: Aerials show aftermath of deadly Kentucky tornadoes
description: More than 70 people died in Kentucky in Friday night's storms, including dozens in a candle factory.

title: 'Difficult to see' - De Gea speaks of fears over Lindelof as Man Utd beat Norwich
description: David de Gea speaks of his fears after Manchester United team-mate Victor Lindelof leaves the pitch with breathing difficulties during Saturday's win over Norwich.

title: Kensington: Man dies after being shot in police confrontation
description: Officers were responding to reports of a man with a firearm at a bank and bookmakers, police say.

title: 'Liverpool fans pay homage but Gerrard uninterested in sentimental return'
description: Phil McNulty observes Steven Gerrard on his return to Anfield and sees a man focused on his role at Aston Villa.

title: Raheem Sterling: Man City star's best goals & stats as he reaches 100 Premier League goals
description: As Raheem Sterling reaches 100 Premier League goals, BBC Sport looks back at some of his best goals and the key stats showing how the Manchester City forward reached the landmark.

title: Kentucky weatherman films tornado 'ground zero'
description: Meteorologist Noah Bergren shows the BBC the "utter devastation" of the tornadoes in the town of Mayfield.

title: Covid: Care home visitors cut to three to slow Omicron spread
description: Residents will be allowed three visitors and one care worker from Wednesday under updated guidance.

title: Queues form as Banksy Colston statue trial T-shirts go on sale
description: The shirts were released to mark the trial of four people accused of toppling the Edward Colston statue.

title: Covid: Omicron study suggests major wave in January
description: More stringent restrictions may be needed to prevent coronavirus from overwhelming hospitals, scientists say.

title: 'England destined to lose first Ashes Test following team selection' - Agnew analysis
description: England were destined to lose the first Ashes Test because of the wrong team selection and a lack of match practice, says Jonathan Agnew.

title: Postponed Tottenham-Rennes will not be rescheduled
description: Tottenham's postponed Europa Conference League game with Rennes - due to be played on 9 December - will not be rescheduled, says Uefa.

title: More than 50 feared dead in Kentucky's worst ever tornadoes
description: The governor of the US state says that the number of victims could rise to 100.

title: Arthur Labinjo-Hughes: Football club's tribute to young fan
description: Birmingham City has renamed the stadium's family zone in memory of the murdered six-year-old.

title: Ex-England cricket captain backs calls for assisted dying
description: Ray Illingworth says he wants people to have a choice after watching his wife die from breast cancer.

title: The papers: Booster can stop Omicron and PM flat row 'deepens'
description: Saturday's papers cover the efficiency of booster jabs against Omicron and rows over PM's flat refurbishment.

title: The Ashes: England slump to defeat against Australia on day four at the Gabba
description: Watch highlights as England lose their last eight wickets for 74 runs as they slump to a crushing nine-wicket defeat against Australia in the first Ashes Test at the Gabba.

title: Women's safety: Why I shared pictures of my assault online
description: Student Reegan Kay posted on Twitter about being assaulted on her way home from a night out.

title: The Ashes: Ben Stokes caught at gully off Pat Cummins
description: Australia's captain Pat Cummins has Ben Stokes caught in the gully as England lose their fourth wicket of the morning session on the fourth day of the first Ashes Test at the Gabba in Brisbane.

title: Russia faces consequences if Ukraine invaded - Truss
description: The foreign secretary says G7 ministers will warn Moscow such action would be a "strategic mistake".

title: The woman who digs for the truth in mass graves
description: Mercedes Doretti has dedicated her life to searching for victims of war and state violence, as part of the Argentine Forensic Anthropology Team.

title: Week in pictures: 4-10 December 2021
description: A selection of powerful images from all over the globe, taken this week.

title: Ghislaine Maxwell trial: Prosecutors rest case after 10 days
description: Prosecutors say Ms Maxwell ran "a pyramid scheme of abuse" with convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Finnish teacher who secretly taught IS children in Syrian camps by text
description: Using WhatsApp, Ilona Taimela found a novel way to educate Finnish children held in a Syrian camp.

title: The Ashes: Joe Root falls early on day four
description: England captain Joe Root is caught behind off the bowling of Cameron Green on the fourth day of the first Ashes Test at the Gabba in Brisbane.

title: Rosie Kay: Dancers write open letter to choreographer after gender row
description: Choreographer Rosie Kay says she was forced out of her company over her views on sex and gender.

title: Watch: Ros Atkins on… Compulsory Covid vaccinations
description: Ros Atkins examines the ethical arguments surrounding vaccine mandates.

title: Houses of Parliament: The search for people to save palace buildings
description: The Palace of Westminster requires urgent repair, but a skills shortage means fresh talent is needed.
